metadata.title: CVE-2017-11641 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 has a Memory Leak in the PersistCache function inmagick/pixel_cache.c during writing of Magick Persistent Cache (MPC) files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11641` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm3
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm3
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm3
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm3
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm3').
